titleInfo.title: Letter, John Watkins in Knoxville, Tenn. to John Probert in Pittsfield, Ohio, 1863 November 1

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated November 1, 1863, from John Watkins in Knoxville, Tenn. to John Probert in Pittsfield, Ohio, Watkins describes the pine log huts that have been built by the soldiers stationed in Knoxville. He also discusses the need for troops in the older regiments: "I sometimes wish and think that it would be a good idea if old Abraham would call out and put into the field enough troops to fill the old regiments up and keep them full." He writes also of operations in the Loudon, Tenn. area.
